info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued January 11 at 6:42AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...The Forest Service Sawtooth Avalanche Center in Ketchum has ISSUED an AVALANCHE WATCH which is in effect from 6 AM Thursday through 6 PM Thursday. * WHAT...Very dangerous avalanche conditions are expected to develop tonight. Backcountry avalanche warnings may be issued. * WHERE...The southern Salmon River, Sawtooth, White Cloud, Smoky, Boulder, Pioneer and Soldier Mountains, including the mountains surrounding Banner Summit, Stanley, Smiley Creek, Atlanta, Galena Summit, and Fairfield. The backcountry avalanche watch does not apply to highway avalanche programs or operating ski areas. * WHEN...In effect from Thursday 6 AM MST to 6 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Large, natural and human-triggered avalanches will become nearly certain to occur as heavy snowfall and strong wind overload a weak snowpack. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... As conditions worsen, travel in avalanche terrain will not be recommended. Stay off of and out from below steep slopes - slopes steeper than about 30 degrees. Avalanches may be triggered remotely - from flat terrain above, below, and to the sides of steep slopes. Natural and human-triggered avalanches may run long distances and can impact gentler terrain below. Consult www.sawtoothavalanche.com or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
